issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: AM crashes due to OOM while serving up map task completion events

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
TaskAttemptListenerImpl implements getMapCompletionEvents by calling Job.getTaskAttemptCompletionEvents with the same fromEvent and maxEvents passed in from the reducer and then filtering the result for just map events. We can't filter the task completion event list and expect the caller's "window" into the list to match up.  As soon as a reducer event appears in the list it means we are redundantly sending map completion events that were already seen by the reducer.

Worst case the reducer will hang if all of the events in the requested window are reducer events.  In that case zero events will be reported back to the caller and it won't bump up fromEvent on the next call.  Reducer then never sees the final map completion events needed to complete the shuffle. This could happen in a case where all maps complete, more than MAX_EVENTS reducers complete consecutively, but some straggling reducers get fetch failures and cause a map to be restarted.
fields.summary: Reducer can fail to make progress during shuffle if too many reducers complete consecutively

comments.body: Patch to add a new method to the AM's Job interface so map task completions can be reliably iterated by reducers.

This message is automatically generated.
I believe the javadoc warnings are from HADOOP-8887 which added @goal and @phase tags that are generating warnings during javadoc generation.
The javadoc warnings are because there are -4 of them, that means there are 4 less then the script expected :)  Someone fixed some and did not update it.

Still reviewing but one request would be to extend TestFetchFailure to: make sure the tasks it returns are truly map tasks and then change to job.getMapAttemptCompletionEvents(0, 3) so that it makes sure the reducer is not included.
Thanks for the review, Tom.  Updated the test case.
